intro: Plectranthus platyphyllus, commonly known as Mexican mint marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its aromatic, square stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and containers. Due to its fragrance and ornamental value, it is also used in herbal medicine and as a natural pest repellent.
